title: Minimal Reliance on Fossil Fuels for Electricity
description: In 2021, Nepal produced only 0.0004% of its electricity from oil, gas, and coal sources, showcasing a strong commitment to renewable energy.

title: Negligible CO2 Emissions from Power Industry
description: Nepal's power industry emitted a mere 0.0001 Mt of CO2 in 2018, reflecting its low carbon footprint in energy production.

title: Low Fugitive CO2 Emissions
description: In 2023, Nepal's fugitive CO2 emissions from energy were just 0.0001 Mt, indicating efficient energy management practices.

title: High Financial Sector Rating
description: Nepal achieved a CPIA financial sector rating of 4 in 2023, suggesting a relatively strong and stable financial environment.

title: Minimal New Displacement Due to Conflict
description: In 2017, Nepal reported only 2 new cases of internal displacement due to conflict and violence, highlighting a peaceful domestic environment.

title: Low Import of Communication and Computer Services
description: In 2023, communications and computer services accounted for just 0.99% of Nepal's service imports, indicating a potential area for growth in digital services.

title: Limited Commercial Service Imports in Technology
description: In 2023, computer, communications, and other services made up only 10.23% of Nepal's commercial service imports, suggesting a need for diversification in service trade.
